com.github.methylene.sym

Class CycleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.CycleUtil

  • public final class CycleUtil
extends Object
    A collection of methods that return cycles or operate on cycles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] asRanking(int... cycle)
      Create a ranking from a cycle in cycle notation.
      static boolean isCycle(int[] a)
      Check if the input defines a cycle.
      static boolean isCyclicRanking(int[] ranking)
      Check if this ranking has at most a single orbit.
      static boolean[] movedIndexes(int[] cycle)
      Get the indexes that are moved by the input cycle.

      Calculate the orbit of an index.
      static int order(int[] ranking, int i)
      Calculate the order of an index in the input ranking.
      static int[][] toOrbits(int[] ranking)
      Find all nontrivial cycles in the input ranking.

    • Method Detail

      • movedIndexes

        public static boolean[] movedIndexes(int[] cycle)
        Get the indexes that are moved by the input cycle.
        Parameters:
        cycle - a cycle in cycle notation
        Returns:
        the indexes that are moved by the cycle
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input does not define a cycle

      • isCycle

        public static boolean isCycle(int[] a)
        Check if the input defines a cycle.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        true if the input defines a cycle, because it contains no negative numbers or duplicates

      • asRanking

        public static int[] asRanking(int... cycle)
        Create a ranking from a cycle in cycle notation.
        Parameters:
        cycle - a cycle in cycle notation
        Returns:
        a ranking that represents the cycle
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input does not define a cycle
        See Also:
        isCycle(int[])

      • order

        public static int order(int[] ranking,
                        int i)
        Calculate the order of an index in the input ranking. This method does not check if the input is indeed a valid ranking and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        i - an integer
        Returns:
        the order of i

      • orbit

        public static int[] orbit(int[] ranking,
                          int i)
        Calculate the orbit of an index. This method does not check if the input is indeed a valid ranking and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        i - an non-negative integer
        Returns:
        the orbit of i
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i is negative

      • isCyclicRanking

        public static boolean isCyclicRanking(int[] ranking)
        Check if this ranking has at most a single orbit. This method does not check if the input is indeed a valid ranking and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        true if the input is a cycle

      • toOrbits

        public static int[][] toOrbits(int[] ranking)
        Find all nontrivial cycles in the input ranking. This method does not check if the input is indeed a valid ranking and will have unexpected results otherwise.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a ranking
        Returns:
        an array of all nontrivial orbits in the input ranking
